Title: Software Engineer 2
Location: Astronautics Corporation of America, Oak Creek, Wisconsin
Description: I am currently working as a full-stack software engineer with a focus on front-end development. I work on a team of 5+ developers to implement new features and maintain existing features. The majority of my time is spent working with React, Node.js, and front-end technologies. Here are some of my responsibilities:
BulletPoints: Interpret and develop new features requested by the customer while coordinating with the quality assurance and testing teams.
Perform manual end-to-end, performance, acceptance, functional, and regression tests while recording results and generating new backlog items as necessary.
Debug RESTful APIs and Postgres database queries in Go and SQL respectively.
Design new reusable components to remove technical debt and improve user experience across all aspects of the website.
Coordinate with multiple teams in the company to relay requirements, statuses, and updates.
Mentor junior developers and conduct code reviews to ensure best practices are followed.

Title: Software Engineer 1
Location: Astronautics Corporation of America, Oak Creek, Wisconsin
Description: While I was a software engineer 1, I worked on a team of 5+ developers. I was responsible for implementing and maintaining features using C programming, project documentation, and writing Python tests for test automation. Here are some of my responsibilities:
BulletPoints: Authored high-level requirements that would then be turned into features.
Developed low-level test cases and procedures using Python to verify the Aircraft FDIMU software.
Created tools to save time with tedious processes such as results entry, result review, documentation, and requirement to test case linking. (Websites, IBM DOORS Integrated Programs, Python scripts)
Used Azure DevOps to create CI/CD pipelines for running automated Python tests overnight.
Implemented complex algorithms for comparing XML configuration files to their corresponding binary versions.

Title: Software Engineering Intern
Location: Astronautics Corporation of America, Oak Creek, Wisconsin
Description: As a software engineering intern, I worked on a team of 5+ developers. I was responsible for writing Python verification tests and developing tools/pipelines to save the team time. Here are some of my responsibilities:
BulletPoints: Designed, developed, and maintained Python libraries used for verification of the Aircraft's FDIMU software.
Implemented Continuous Integration (CI/CD) pipelines in Azure for running tests, code formatters, and hardware/software smoke tests.
Learned how to program using IBM DOORS' custom language DXL to make automated programs we could run on our requirements and test cases.
